For example, {@code Object} + * declares
+ * {@code protected Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {...}}
+ * and {@code EnumSet} declares its language-level {@linkplain java.util.EnumSet#clone() covariant override}
+ * {@code public EnumSet clone() {...}}
+ * If this technique was being used, the resulting class + * file for {@code EnumSet} would have two {@code clone} methods, + * one returning {@code EnumSet} and the second a bridge method + * returning {@code Object}. The bridge method is a JVM-level override of {@code Object.clone()}. + * The body of the {@code clone} bridge + * method calls its non-bridge counterpart and returns its + * result. @@ -576,0 +605,4 @@ + * + * @jls 8.4.8.3 Requirements in Overriding and Hiding + * @jls 15.12.4.5 Create Frame, Synchronize, Transfer Control + * @jvms 4.6 Methods @@ -593,0 +626,1 @@ + * @jvms 4.6 Methods
